TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was born at GPE . When the ORG last received information concerning his whereabouts , he was in detention at the prison of ORG ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Monza public prosecutor ’s office ordered Mr PERSON ’s arrest together with that of a number of other persons . They were suspected of involvement in the kidnapping and death of a young man , PERSON , who had been kidnapped on DATE and who , on DATE , had been found dead from an overdose of chloroform . The public prosecutor ’s decision was based on the statements of a certain Mr D. , who had been asked by the organisers of the kidnapping to assist them by keeping watch over the victim , but had decided to co - operate with the carabinieri .

CARDINAL . When interviewed by the carabinieri on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE and by the public prosecutor on DATE , Mr NORP provided information on the preparation of the kidnapping and on the contacts which he claimed to have had at the time with Mr GPE and CARDINAL PERSON also alleged that he had been threatened because he had not wanted to participate in the crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of an examination by the public prosecutor , the applicant admitted knowing Mr NORP , but denied having asked him to take part in the offence . He also rejected the suggestion that there was any enmity between them .

CARDINAL . Before the investigating judge , who questioned him on DATE , he referred to disputes with Mr NORP ; he added that the latter had asked him to take part in a kidnapping , but that he had refused to do so .

On DATE the same judge interviewed Mr NORP , who confirmed his earlier statements and gave various details concerning his conversations with Mr GPE and PERSON , including a meeting on DATE with Mr PERSON .

CARDINAL . Again on DATE the investigating judge confronted Mr NORP with the applicant who , in accordance with the provisions in force at the time ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , was not assisted by his lawyer . Each of them repeated his own version of events . The record of the confrontation reads as follows ( translation from the NORP ) :

" ... NORP to GPE ... : I confirm the statements made to the carabinieri and to the investigating judge . I confirm in particular that at the beginning of DATE you asked me to take part in a kidnapping . Before , DATE , you had talked generally about the possibility of earning a bit of money .

Isgrò ... to NORP : You ’re not telling the truth , it ’s not true that I proposed to you to take part in a kidnapping . It was exactly the opposite which happened . You came to my place - I do n’t remember exactly when - and you proposed that I guard a kidnap victim . I did n’t even want to listen to you and I threw you out .
NORP to GPE ... : That ’s all lies , what I said before is true .
Isgrò ... to NORP : You ’re saying what you ’ve just said because you ’ve been angry with me ever since , when your aunt PERSON asked me , I stopped a fight between you and a certain N.

NORP to GPE ... : I also confirm that I met you , the day of the kidnapping , in the ... bar of Malnate . On that occasion you explained to me what I would have to do during the detention of the kidnap victim and in particular how I should get him to write the messages to his family . You also told me that I should be seen out and about as usual .

Isgrò ... to NORP : In DATE before my arrest , I did go once to the ... bar in Malnate with my family and an aunt whom I had taken to GPE for a trip . If I remember correctly it was in fact on DATE , I do n’t remember the time . I had accompanied my aunt who was to telephone to GPE , but I do n’t remember at all having seen you and even less having spoken to you .
NORP to GPE ... : I repeat what I stated before , I saw you shortly before twelve o’clock .
Isgrò ... to NORP : It ’s not true , I was not in the bar at that time , I do n’t remember exactly where I was , but I remember that I only went to the bar in the afternoon .
NORP to GPE ... : I confirm that you know the PERSON brothers and in particular that I saw PERSON go to your house .
Isgrò ... to NORP : It ’s absolutely untrue that I knew the PERSON [ brothers ] . You ’re lying .
NORP to GPE ... : I repeat that you yourself told me that DATE you used to go to the Pizzeria ... in Malnate with the PERSON [ brothers ] .
Isgrò ... to NORP : That ’s all lies . You want to destroy me because you ’ve never forgiven me for not helping you in your crooked deals .
NORP to GPE ... : I myself have seen you in the company of the PERSON [ brothers ] at the Pizzeria ... in Malnate .
Isgrò ... to NORP : I repeat that that ’s not true . I ’ve never seen the PERSON [ brothers ] .
ORG ... "
On DATE the investigating judge organised a confrontation between Mr D. and another accused , namely CARDINAL of the PERSON brothers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating judge questioned for CARDINAL last time Mr NORP , who maintained his allegations .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge committed Mr GPE and CARDINAL co - accused for trial in the Monza ORG .

CARDINAL . At the public prosecutor ’s request , the President of ORG ordered Mr NORP to be called as a witness at the hearing on DATE . On being informed , on DATE , that it had been impossible to trace the person concerned for DATE , he ordered that inquiries be made immediately . These inquiries were conducted in CARDINAL separate places , but they were unsuccessful although Mr NORP telephoned the carabinieri on DATE and the investigating judge on DATE .

CARDINAL . The trial was spread over CARDINAL hearings from DATE . The court heard , among others , the applicant , his wife and a number of witnesses . However , it refused to call a person who had already been questioned by the investigating judge : counsel for Mr PERSON sought to have this witness called in connection with evidence concerning PERSON conduct on DATE of the kidnapping , of which the person in question had informed PERSON according to the latter ’s statements before the court ; but in the court ’s view the evidence available to it deprived this testimony of any importance .

As Mr NORP remained impossible to trace , the records of each of his interviews and of the confrontation of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) were read out on DATE . This had been ordered by the court in pursuance of LAW , first paragraph , sub - paragraph CARDINAL , of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , notwithstanding the objections of the lawyers of CARDINAL of the applicant ’s co - accused .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , the applicant ’s lawyer indicated that his client ’s wife had seen Mr NORP in the street at ORG , where he had been staying for DATE at his mother ’s house . The President of ORG ordered that the police be informed of this immediately .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG sentenced Mr GPE to DATE imprisonment . In the grounds of its judgment , it relied on PERSON statements rather than the applicant ’s denials .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed and sought to have Mr NORP called as a witness . ORG directed that the latter appear on DATE after its first hearing - , but further searches effected in CARDINAL places , CARDINAL of which had been indicated , once again , by PERSON , were to no avail .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court upheld the verdict of guilty but reduced the sentence to DATE . It based its decision in particular on the earlier statements by Mr NORP In its view , he was in hiding for fear of reprisals , a fear which it considered to be fully justified .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON appealed on points of law . He complained that he had been convicted on the basis of testimony obtained during the investigation , without his lawyer having had the opportunity to examine the witness in question on his statements , and challenged the use of such evidence in the trial proceedings .
ORG dismissed the appeal on DATE on the ground that it was intended to contest the assessment of evidence made by the lower courts , which assessment was not open to appeal .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL bis of LAW in force at the time enumerated the steps in the investigation at which an accused ’s lawyer could be present ; it did not mention confrontations between the accused and a witness .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided a list of the statements which the trial courts were authorised , subject to certain conditions , to have read out at the trial ; they included statements obtained by an investigating judge during a confrontation between a witness and an accused .
Under sub - paragraph CARDINAL of the first paragraph , such statements might be read out where , inter alia , a witness could no longer be traced .
